means: 小山，山冈( hill的名词复数 )
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 希尔斯 Hill的变体
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 希尔斯取自父名，含义是“希尔之子”(son of Hill)

sentence.Network_en: A smallholding in the hills could not support a large family.
sentence.Network_cn: 山间的一小块耕地是不可能养活一大家人的。

sentence.Network_en: The soil washed from the hills is silting up the hydroelectric dams.
sentence.Network_cn: 从山上冲刷下来的泥土就要让水电大坝淤塞了。

sentence.Network_en: The road is a succession of hairpin bends, hills, and blind corners.
sentence.Network_cn: 这条路上急转弯、坡道和死拐角一个接一个。

shadows on the hills , sketch the trees and the daffodils ., 山丘上的阴影 , 描绘出树与水仙花.

in Guangzhou and the nearby hills the hills are not high land is not very appropriate choice of the performance of pumps the flow ratio of small axialpump centrifugal pump and flow than ;在广州附近的丘陵地带，山丘并不高，地块不很大，适宜选用水泵的性能，其流量比轴流泵小，而又要比离心泵流量大；
The little village perches high among the hills ., 小村庄高踞于群山之中.

entry.def: A hill is an area of land that is higher than the land that surrounds it.

example.ex: We trudged up the hill to the stadium.
example.tran: 我们费力地爬到山上的体育场。

entry.tran: 人老珠黄;在走下坡路;在衰退中;过气
entry.def: If you say that someone is over the hill, you are saying rudely that they are old and no longer fit, attractive, or capable of doing useful work.

example.ex: He doesn't take kindly to suggestions that he is over the hill.
example.tran: 他不爱听别人说他风光不再。

sentences.sentence: "they loved to roam the hills of West Virginia"

Sentence.sentence: Although many of Hills dale's students came from wealthy households, by the late 1990 average test scores were sliding and it had earned the unaffectionate nickname (绰号) "Hills jail.

A Hills dale teacher who became principal last year, remembers sitting with other teachers watching students file out of a graduation ceremony and asking one another in astonishment, "How did that student graduate
So in 2003 Hills dale remade itself into three "houses," romantically named Florence, Marrakech and Kyoto.
